meanings.definition: The property of being a ferrimagnetic material.
meanings.sent1: The scientist studied the ferrimagnetisms of the new material in the lab.
meanings.sent2: The ferrimagnetisms of the magnet made it attract other objects.
meanings.sent3: The ferrimagnetisms of the metal were so strong that even paper clips stuck to it!
meanings.sent4: Her personality had the ferrimagnetisms of a strong magnetic field, drawing people towards her.
meanings.sent5: The ferrimagnetisms of the lodestone were so powerful that sailors used it for navigation.

meanings.definition: The phenomenon of ferrimagnetic behavior in a substance.
meanings.sent1: The researchers observed the ferrimagnetisms of the material under a microscope.
meanings.sent2: The ferrimagnetisms of the compound were evident when it reacted to the magnetic field.
meanings.sent3: The ferrimagnetisms of the fridge magnet made it stick to the refrigerator in a funny way.
meanings.sent4: His words had the ferrimagnetisms of a strong argument, convincing everyone in the room.
meanings.sent5: The ferrimagnetisms of the iron filings aligning in the magnetic field were mesmerizing to watch.
